text: A trikini is a three-piece garment used as a beachwear. The three pieces are sold together, such as a bikini with a tank top. A bikini with a one-piece suit is also sometimes called a trikini.John Karl, "Under cover Designers are wrapping swimsuits with stylish designs, Sarasota Herald Tribune, 200-02-08 Its name is formed from bikini, (itself named for Bikini Atoll) replacing "bi-", as if to mean "two", with "tri-", meaning "three".Robert L. Chapman & Harold Wentworth, New Dictionary of American Slang, p. 446, Harper & Row, 1986, . In response to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on fashion, a new variety of trikini was designed – including a matching face mask. ==Variations== A woman wearing a trikini * The trikini appeared briefly in 1967, defined as "a handkerchief and two small saucers." It reappeared a few years ago as a bikini bottom with a stringed halter of two triangular pieces of cloth covering the breasts.William Safire, No Uncertain Terms, p. 291, Simon & Schuster, 2004, * Dolce & Gabbana designed trikinis for Summer 2005 as three pieces of scintillating fabric that barely cover the wearer.Associated Press, "Free and easy", The Age (Australia), 2004-06-29 * Another variation on the bikini in which including a conventional two-piece with a glitzy band of rhinestones round the waist.Katia Dolmadjian, "The hottest trends from Milan", iAfrica, 2007-09-28 * Israeli designer Gideon Oberson, known for his artistically inspired bathing suits, calls a two-piece suit but looks like a tank top that can be worn with a skirt or a pair of shorts designed by him a trikini.Meredith Price Levitt, "Sabra Style: Sizzling summer swimwear", The Jerusalem Post, 2008-07-13. * Brazilian designer Amir Slama calls two scraps of silk connected with string he designed for skinny women a trikini.Amy Diluna, For those who dare, he does bare Brazilian designer reinvents itsy-bitsy, teeny-weeny bikini", Daily News (New York), 2004-09-11. * During the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, a new variation of trikini, with two pieces for the body and a face mask was designed. Indian film actress Kajol popularized the idea of this trikini. ==References== Category:Bikinis Category:Responses to the COVID-19 pandemic
